results.title: Lend Us a Hand
results.creator_credit: David Withers, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: Like all small towns, Mirboo North survives on the support of its dedicated volunteers. This film features some of the many volunteer groups that are active in Mirboo North. From the local Op Shop to the Wednesday Warriors and the Mirboo North Times, it captures the community spirit of giving.
results.description: Like all small towns, Mirboo North survives on the support of its dedicated volunteers. This film features some of the many volunteer groups that are active in Mirboo North. From the local Op Shop to the Wednesday Warriors and the Mirboo North Times, it captures the community spirit of giving.

results.title: Vocal Nosh
results.creator_credit: David Withers, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: The power of song and food brings together a community for fun and companionship. A monthly gathering at the Grainstore in Mirboo North unites people with a love for singing and a desire to connect with others in their town.
results.description: The power of song and food brings together a community for fun and companionship. A monthly gathering at the Grainstore in Mirboo North unites people with a love for singing and a desire to connect with others in their town.

results.title: Young Voices of Mirboo North
results.creator_credit: David Withers, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: Do you want to know what this generation really thinks? Hear from the youth of Mirboo North, as they discuss matters of importance such as their future hopes, the threat of climate change and what they would miss most about living in their town.
results.description: Do you want to know what this generation really thinks? Hear from the youth of Mirboo North, as they discuss matters of importance such as their future hopes, the threat of climate change and what they would miss most about living in their town.

results.title: Music is Sweet
results.creator_credit: Roberto Salvatore, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: Share the joy of music with these amazing young voices from Poowong Consolidated School. Meet the kids and teachers of this inspirational primary school where writing, recording and performing songs is taught hand-in-hand with all the other standard subjects. Students of all grades are given the opportunity to express themselves through music and to perform their songs infront of their peers and the community.
results.description: Share the joy of music with these amazing young voices from Poowong Consolidated School. Students of all grades are given the opportunity to express themselves through music and to perform their songs infront of their peers and the community.

results.title: An Interview with Pat Vines: The Shrine of Remembrance
results.creator_credit: Pat Vines and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: After Pat Vines returns from the war as a Commander of the Australian Navy, one of her senior navy officers recommends her to the Shrine of Remembrance Trustees, which she joins. She tells of her time as a Trustee for the Shrine.

results.title: The Lucky years
results.creator_credit: Brian Luscombe and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Brian Luscombe enlisted in the Air Force on Australia Day 1942. He was 18 and wanted to be a pilot. Dubbed Lucky Luscombe, Brian talks about his years as a pilot in the RAAF in World War II.

results.title: Mary and Max: The Exhibition: interview with Adam Elliot March 2010
results.brief_description: Oscar winning animation director and writer Adam Elliot speaks candidly about his stop frame animation processes and, more importantly, about why he makes films. Adam also talks about the challenges he faced during the making of his first feature film ‘Mary and Max’.
results.title_for_label: Mary and Max: The Exhibition: interview with Adam Elliot March 2010

results.title: TV50 Celebrity Interviews
results.creator_credit: Astrid Scott, ACMI Content Development and ACMI
results.brief_description: Interviews with thirteen celebrities from Australian television. Asked the same questions, their responses are recorded vox pop style. Questions asked concern the celebrities’ experiences of television both as a viewer and as a personality and performer as well as their thoughts on reality television and the state of Australian television in general. Interviews were conducted at ACMI for the TV50 exhibition in 2006.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Astrid Scott, ACMI Content Development and ACMI

results.title: Interview with Christopher Doyle
results.brief_description:
Australian cinematographer Christopher Doyle talks about how time operates in his filmmaking, how life experience has shaped his work, the role of repetition, structure and movement in cinematogrpahy, how space informs and influences his technique, and about the collaborative process of filmmaking.
Includes clips from ‘Paranoid Park’ 2007; ‘Days of Being Wild’ (A Fei zheng chuan), 1990; ‘Happy Together’ (Chun gwong cha sit), 1997; ‘In the Mood for Love’ (Fa yeung nin wa), 2000; and ‘Fallen Angels’ (Duo luo tian shi), 1995.
results.description:

results.title: In conversation with Graham Leader
results.brief_description:
‘Heartworn Highways’ (1981) captures singer-songwriters such as Townes Van Zandt, Guy Clark, Rodney Crowell, a young Steve Earle and Steve Young living and performing in the heart of pure Country.
Producer Graham Leader talks about the genesis of the documentary ‘Heartworn Highways’. Interview recorded as part of ‘Drifters, Dreamers and Cowboys’ 24 November 2008.
